definition: to leave (a message etc)/to retain/to stay/to remain/to keep/to preserve

sentences.english: With his team of workers, he invented an electric light bulb, the phonograph.
sentences.chinese: 他作出了六千项发明，包括电灯泡，留声机和油印机。

sentences.english: You are recording as it is recorded on a gramophone plate.
sentences.chinese: 你在做记录，就像歌曲被刻录在留声机的唱片上。

sentences.english: I also have a variety of placeables, from pianos to phonographs to cable cars.
sentences.chinese: 我有大量的可放置物品，从钢琴到留声机到缆车。

sentences.english: None of this nudity and gramophones half the night.
sentences.chinese: 没有那种裸体，也没有半夜还开着的留声机。

sentences.english: A man chews up a gramophone record.
sentences.chinese: 一个男子在大嚼留声机唱片。

sentences.english: The voice of the Edison gramophone was first heard by visitors in World Expo.
sentences.chinese: 人们在世博会上第一次听到从留声机里发出的声音。

sentences.english: It was one of those old-fashioned gramophones that winds up.
sentences.chinese: 那是一台上弦的老式留声机。

sentences.english: The mike resembled an old-fashioned gramophone horn.
sentences.chinese: 话筒看起来很像老式留声机的喇叭。

sentences.english: In 1888, Gouraud sailed for Britain, where he set about establishing a market for the Phonograph.
sentences.chinese: 1888年，高洛德去了英国，着手开拓留声机市场。

sentences.english: Xu Zhengfan to bell bought the phonograph, put up the music.
sentences.chinese: 许正帆给钟离买来了留声机，放起了音乐。

sentences.english: His Graphophone still enjoyed a couple of advantages.
sentences.chinese: 他的格拉福风留声机依然拥有几项优势。

sentences.english: The telephone and the gramophone were contemporary inventions.
sentences.chinese: 电话和留声机是同一时代的发明。

sentences.english: The voice of the Edison gramophone was first heard by visits in World Expo .
sentences.chinese: 人们在世博会上第一次听到从留声机里发出的声音。

sentences.english: Edison's phonograph is the distant ancestor of today's CD player.
sentences.chinese: 爱迪生的留声机是今日CD唱盘的老祖宗。

sentences.english: So weird I could hear the stylus etching its way into the flat vinyl of the record.
sentences.chinese: 奇怪到我似乎能够听到留声机的唱针划过唱片的声音。
